Kids are highly malleable and change interests all the time. Until they are old enough to really understand their decisions fully, they need guidance. That even goes with highschoolers. I think it would be better to push your kids in a general direction and if they feel strongly that they dont wanna take that path, then talk with them and help direct them towards something that they'll like and will be able to make a career out of. I'm not sure what youre talking about putting up walls. All i'm saying is that its more socially acceptable for guys to be into computer stuff than girls, and maybe we should treat a girls interest in that kinda stuff the same as boys. And in general, we should encourage all kids to get into STEM fields.
what in the fuck is hannouka? Is that some kind of Jewish anime?
Spoken like someone with a lot of privilege.

Exactly, it needs to come from the social level. Girls need to be encouraged by parents to get into STEM fields. Other girls and boys should not be making fun of girls for being into computers, science, math, engineering, etc. It's cool, and they'll have great careers pursuing those kinds of fields.

I'd imagine four kings would be a bitch, as would manus. I can't imagine any other bosses being difficult using this tactic. I've been doing an intelligence build, only leveling attunement as my other skill. Just because I hit 40 int, i only now started adding to vitality and endurance. I've had a ridiculously easy time with every boss so far. I can't see how a couple less attunement slots and a little bit less vitality and endurance would make the game that much harder. Plus you could always use Darkmoon Seance ring for extra attunement.

WRITING.TITLE: What's worse than being tortured, raped and killed?
WRITING.TEXT: Watching your only child suffer horribly and die slowly from terminal brain cancer and then being tortured, raped and killed.

Okay. Yeah I can definitely see how that can be annoying. It seems like the person is not being genuine and also on big decisions its likely that you've already went through the logical points of your choices. I confess though I am highly guilty of this. I am absolutely awful at being emotionally supportive so pretty much all of my advice is like this. I have a very hard time empathizing with people and letting my emotions loose. The best thing you can probably do is just tell that friend that you've already gone through the facts and logical arguments behind your decision, but you wanna hear their feelings on it.

So if I'm understanding correctly, you don't want to be given "logical" advice, you want the person to tell you how they intuitively feel about your decision? If you ask a friend about which school you want to go to, you don't want them just to tell you logical reasons to choose one school over the other, but you want them to give kind of a gut instinct type of response, given that they know you pretty well?
Yes. I have a bad habit of debating online and wasting time better spent doing something else so I think so I really wanna spend time arguing or should I just delete my comment and move on?
Well said

If you're friendly I'm sure they don't hate you. Yes it's a pain but I hate the customer who is never satisfied more than the customer who wants something difficult to slice. Key word, BOTH. I have no issue with pro criticizing the lies of the Trump administration. In fact, I highly encourage it. I was no supporter of trump. What drives me absolutely nuts is the people who will not acknowledge the lies of the Obama administration and/or cannot acknowledge the lies spread by those on the left of the spectrum. People are acting like this is the first time our government has ever lied to us. Same goes with the media. Everyone loves to bash conservative outlets for being heavily biased and filled with misinformation, but they don't wanna acknowledge the fact that Slate, Vox, HuffPo, Buzzfeed and even CNN and MSNBC, etc. are heavily biased and some I would even say not reputable at all. It really does go both way. I would love for those on either side of the spectrum have a shred of honesty when talking about these things.

I don't really think so unless the person selling it to you literally owns the deli. Even then I'd probably say no. .1 is a fair amount over though. My rule of thumb is to keep it within .05.

I'd say more people ask for it by the pound. I do get a fair amount who ask for a certain number of slices though. I agree with you it makes more sense in slices as someone buying it. It's also nice as the person slicing because then you don't need to worry about weight.
